heading: 'phantom' of the music channel
subheading: mtv releases a four-minute video teaser from the star wars: episode i -- the phantom menace soundtrack. suddenly, the london symphony orchestra is hot.
author: reuters
text: fans have to wait until 19 may to see the new  star wars movie, but they can hear part of it monday when mtv premieres a video hors d'oeuvre of the eagerly awaited film.the four-minute music video of clips from star wars: episode i -- the phantom menace features the soundtrack by john williams, who also composed the music for the original star wars trilogy.the video, which contains scenes from the new film starring liam neeson and ewan mcgregor, also has behind-the-scenes looks at williams working on the movie soundtrack with the london symphony orchestra.mtv has an exclusive agreement with lucasfilm, makers of the film, to air the video titled "dual of the fates," which debuts at 3:30 p.m. et on mtv. after that, it will be added to the network's regular music-video rotation."even if you are not a star wars fan, the video will blow you away," mtv senior vice president tom calderone said.after the premiere, mtv's sister music channel, vh1, will show the video five times, back-to-back starting at 6 p.m., when vh1's older audience is likely to be watching."for adults, being the first kid on the block to see something isn't so important anymore," vh1 vice president mike tierney told the new york daily news.copyright
